item.title: Auto Jar
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:14, topic:427342”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=530038.msg3869403#msg3869403 date=1325229227]

tbh–waste of time using this when i could do it, portability-ensured, on my own in like 10 sec.

gj

Isn’t there a shell command for this anyway?

Not in Windows lol.

Anyways, I use a copy of JarMaker i obtained from a webclient tutorial back when I was heavy into RSPS. I’ll give this out a try though. Gj
[/quote]
it exists in windows, it is provided by SDK.[/quote]
I was just going to say this, the ‘jar’ command line tool is there on windows and every other operating system the Java JDK supports. Normally you either have your IDE do this for you, or you have an ANT build to do it for you, or you have a script set up to do it for you.

This tool does look good as a learning experience with UIs though.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Jar
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Davidi2:

I don’t see why anyone should be ‘happy’, per se, there are plenty of tools that can do this for you already. JarMaker is one perfectly fine example.

The tools provided with the JDK work as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Jar
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:9, topic:427342”]Create batch script? That’s a joke right?

Kinda defeats the purpose of a jar (especially when you’re just using the env-path ‘java’), as if they have that set and Java installed correctly, doubling clicking a jar will run it.

And Fridder is right, if I had any reason to believe you were going to use your Java ‘DDoSer’ or that you made it for anything besides learning or experience, you’d probably get banned.[/quote]

The batch script is used for testing purposes of the jar. Similar to how Jar maker had it used for. Sure if you double click it, it will execute. But if something is wrong, or errors are thrown you won’t be able to see an active print out of it.

What I design is my business, if you don’t like me discussing creating applications to test security and bench marking stability, then go ahead and get upset about it. Unlike the majority of people on these sites, I see the lack of personal gain from taking down sites.

Anyways someone had asked me to design a jar app awhile ago and I never got around to it, so this was what I quickly wrote up.

Edit:

Also this is for my own application software, be happy I release anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Jar

@davidi2 wrote:

Create batch script? That’s a joke right?

Kinda defeats the purpose of a jar (especially when you’re just using the env-path ‘java’), as if they have that set and Java installed correctly, doubling clicking a jar will run it.

And Fridder is right, if I had any reason to believe you were going to use your Java ‘DDoSer’ or that you made it for anything besides learning or experience, you’d probably get banned.

item.title: Auto Jar
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:1, topic:427342”]I created this out of boredom along with my Java based DDoSer. Since only one of those is legal to release, this is what I’m releasing. Enjoy. I don’t care about feedback as this wasn’t written under the expectations of advancing from a basic jar application.

AutoJar.java


package org.arsenal.tools;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.jar.Attributes;
import java.util.jar.JarEntry;
import java.util.jar.JarOutputStream;
import java.util.jar.Manifest;

import javax.swing.JProgressBar;

/**
 * Created under the @see Arsenal Software Licensing 
 * @author Arsenal Development Team
 *
 */
public class AutoJar {
	/**
	 * File Directory of the listing of files to compress
	 */
	public static String dirName = "";
	/**
	 * Output Jar File name
	 */
	public static String outputName = "";
	/**
	 * Filter Word Result
	 */
	private static String filterWord = ".class";
	/**
	 * Main executable class
	 */
	public static String mainFile = "";
	/**
	 * Manifest Version
	 */
	private static String manifestVersion = "1.0";
	/**
	 * Create Manifest File
	 */
	public static boolean isManifest;
	/**
	 * Filter by File Type
	 */
	public static boolean isFiltered;
	/**
	 * Manifest File
	 */
	private static Manifest manifest;
	/**
	 * Progress Bar
	 */
	public static JProgressBar progressBar;
	
	public AutoJar() {
		try {
			if(isManifest) {
				manifest = new Manifest();
				System.out.println("Creating manifest...");
				appendAttributes(manifest);
			} else {
				manifest = new Manifest();
			}
			JarOutputStream out = new JarOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(dirName+"/"+outputName), manifest);
			System.out.println("Getting all files in directory: "+dirName);
			getAllFiles(out);
			out.close();
			System.out.println("Jar Successfully Created.");
		} catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		} catch (IOException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}
	/**
	 * Gets all Files in directory listing
	 * @param out JarOutputStream
	 * @throws IOException
	 */
	public static void getAllFiles(JarOutputStream out) throws IOException {
		File directory = new File(dirName);
		File[] files = directory.listFiles();
		for(int i = 0; i < files.length; i++) {
			/**
			 * If file does not contain filtered word result we skip it from compression
			 */
			if(isFiltered) {
				if(!files[i].getName().endsWith(filterWord))
					return;
			}
			progressBar.setValue(i);
			JarEntry filesToAdd = new JarEntry(files[i].getName());
			filesToAdd.setTime(files[i].lastModified());
			out.putNextEntry(filesToAdd);
			System.out.println("[Compressing] "+files[i].getName());
			compressFile(out, files[i]);
		}
		progressBar.setValue(100);
	}
	/**
	 * Compresses File into output Jar file
	 * @param out JarOutputStream
	 * @param file File to Compress
	 * @throws IOException
	 */
	public static void compressFile(JarOutputStream out, File file) throws IOException {
		byte[] buffer = new byte[10240];
		FileInputStream fileIn = new FileInputStream(file);
		while(true) {
			int length = fileIn.read(buffer, 0, buffer.length);
			if(length <= 0)
				break;
			out.write(buffer, 0, length);
		}
		fileIn.close();
	}
	/**
	 * Creates Manifest with given attributes
	 * @param manifest Manifest File
	 */
	public static void appendAttributes(Manifest manifest) {
		manifest.getMainAttributes().put(Attributes.Name.MANIFEST_VERSION, manifestVersion);
		manifest.getMainAttributes().put(Attributes.Name.MAIN_CLASS, mainFile.replace(".class", ""));
	}

}

AutoJarApp.java

package org.arsenal.tools.manager;

import java.awt.Checkbox;

/**
 * Created Under the @see Arsenal Software Licensing
 * Simple Auto Jar Application Graphic Interface
 * @author Arsenal Development Team
 *
 */
public class AutoJarApp extends JFrame {

	private static final long serialVersionUID = 8068205405642771168L;

	private JTextField fileName;
	private JTextField mainClass;
	private Checkbox createMan;
	private Checkbox createBatch;
	private Checkbox filterType;
	private JFileChooser jFileChooser;
	private String directory = "";
	private JLabel directoryLabel;
	private JProgressBar progressBar;
	
	public AutoJarApp() {
		try {
			UIManager.setLookAndFeel(UIManager.getSystemLookAndFeelClassName());
		} catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		} catch (InstantiationException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		} catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		} catch (UnsupportedLookAndFeelException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
		setSize(430, 385);
		setResizable(false);
		setTitle("Auto Jar");
		getContentPane().setLayout(null);
		
		final JDesktopPane desktopPane = new JDesktopPane();
		desktopPane.setBackground(Color.WHITE);
		desktopPane.setBounds(0, 0, 426, 373);
		getContentPane().add(desktopPane);
		
		JButton createJar = new JButton("Create Jar");
		createJar.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
			public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent arg0) {
				JFrame error = new JFrame();
				if(directory.isEmpty() || directory == null) {
					JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(error, "Invalid file directory.", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE, null);
					return;
				}
				if(fileName.getText().isEmpty() || fileName.getText().equals("")) {
					JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(error, "Invalid Output name.", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE, null);
					return;
				}
				if(mainClass.getText().isEmpty() || mainClass.getText().equals("")) {
					JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(error, "Invalid Main Class.", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE, null);
					return;
				}
				System.out.println("Continued");
				AutoJar.outputName = fileName.getText()+".jar";
				AutoJar.mainFile = mainClass.getText()+".class";
				AutoJar.isManifest = createMan.getState();
				AutoJar.isFiltered = filterType.getState();
				AutoJar.dirName = directory;
				AutoJar.progressBar = progressBar;
				boolean isBatch = createBatch.getState();
				new AutoJar();
				if(isBatch) {
					File batchFile = new File(directory+"/"+fileName.getText()+".bat");
					try {
						BufferedWriter buffWrite = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(batchFile));
						PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(buffWrite);
						writer.println("@ECHO OFF");
						writer.println("ECHO THIS BATCH IS FOR TESTING PURPOSES ONLY");
						writer.println("ECHO DOUBLE CLICK "+fileName.getText()+".jar TO EXECUTE IT");
						writer.println("ECHO DEVELOPED UNDER ARSENAL SOFTWARE LICENSING");
						writer.println("ECHO CHECK YOUR LICENSE FROM REGISTRATION FOR MORE INFO");
						writer.println("@ECHO ON");
						writer.println("java -jar "+fileName.getText()+".jar");
						writer.println("@ECHO OFF");
						writer.println("pause");
						writer.flush();
						writer.close();
					} catch (IOException e) {
						e.printStackTrace();
					}
				}
			}
		});
		createJar.setBounds(22, 288, 377, 63);
		desktopPane.add(createJar);
		
		progressBar = new JProgressBar();
		progressBar.setStringPainted(true);
		progressBar.setBounds(22, 231, 377, 31);
		desktopPane.add(progressBar);
		
		createMan = new Checkbox("Create Manifest");
		createMan.setBounds(22, 186, 122, 22);
		desktopPane.add(createMan);
		
		filterType = new Checkbox("Filter File Type");
		filterType.setBounds(150, 186, 95, 22);
		desktopPane.add(filterType);
		
		createBatch = new Checkbox("Create Batch Script");
		createBatch.setBounds(271, 186, 128, 22);
		desktopPane.add(createBatch);
		
		JButton inputFiles = new JButton("Set Input Files");
		inputFiles.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
			public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
				jFileChooser = new JFileChooser();
				jFileChooser.setFileSelectionMode(JFileChooser.DIRECTORIES_ONLY);
				int returnValue = jFileChooser.showOpenDialog(AutoJarApp.this);
				if(returnValue == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
					directory = jFileChooser.getSelectedFile().getPath();
					directoryLabel.setText(directory);
				}
			}
		});
		inputFiles.setBounds(22, 25, 377, 23);
		desktopPane.add(inputFiles);
		
		fileName = new JTextField();
		fileName.setBounds(22, 84, 377, 20);
		desktopPane.add(fileName);
		fileName.setColumns(10);
		
		JLabel lblNewLabel = new JLabel("Output File Name (Ex: project1):");
		lblNewLabel.setBounds(22, 59, 207, 14);
		desktopPane.add(lblNewLabel);
		
		mainClass = new JTextField();
		mainClass.setBounds(22, 140, 377, 20);
		desktopPane.add(mainClass);
		mainClass.setColumns(10);
		
		JLabel lblMainClassex = new JLabel("Main Class (Ex: client):");
		lblMainClassex.setBounds(22, 115, 149, 14);
		desktopPane.add(lblMainClassex);
		
		directoryLabel = new JLabel("");
		directoryLabel.setBounds(22, 11, 377, 14);
		desktopPane.add(directoryLabel);
	}
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		new AutoJarApp().setVisible(true);
	}
}

Image:

Credits:
Arsenal Development Team

Programmer: Emily/Pure Slay[/quote]

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/io/FileFilter.html

Other than that looks fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Jar
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

I created this out of boredom along with my Java based DDoSer. Since only one of those is legal to release, this is what I’m releasing. Enjoy. I don’t care about feedback as this wasn’t written under the expectations of advancing from a basic jar application.

AutoJar.java


package org.arsenal.tools;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.jar.Attributes;
import java.util.jar.JarEntry;
import java.util.jar.JarOutputStream;
import java.util.jar.Manifest;

import javax.swing.JProgressBar;

/**
 * Created under the @see Arsenal Software Licensing 
 * @author Arsenal Development Team
 *
 */
public class AutoJar {
	/**
	 * File Directory of the listing of files to compress
	 */
	public static String dirName = "";
	/**
	 * Output Jar File name
	 */
	public static String outputName = "";
	/**
	 * Filter Word Result
	 */
	private static String filterWord = ".class";
	/**
	 * Main executable class
	 */
	public static String mainFile = "";
	/**
	 * Manifest Version
	 */
	private static String manifestVersion = "1.0";
	/**
	 * Create Manifest File
	 */
	public static boolean isManifest;
	/**
	 * Filter by File Type
	 */
	public static boolean isFiltered;
	/**
	 * Manifest File
	 */
	private static Manifest manifest;
	/**
	 * Progress Bar
	 */
	public static JProgressBar progressBar;
	
	public AutoJar() {
		try {
			if(isManifest) {
				manifest = new Manifest();
				System.out.println("Creating manifest...");
				appendAttributes(manifest);
			} else {
				manifest = new Manifest();
			}
			JarOutputStream out = new JarOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(dirName+"/"+outputName), manifest);
			System.out.println("Getting all files in directory: "+dirName);
			getAllFiles(out);
			out.close();
			System.out.println("Jar Successfully Created.");
		} catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		} catch (IOException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}
	/**
	 * Gets all Files in directory listing
	 * @param out JarOutputStream
	 * @throws IOException
	 */
	public static void getAllFiles(JarOutputStream out) throws IOException {
		File directory = new File(dirName);
		File[] files = directory.listFiles();
		for(int i = 0; i < files.length; i++) {
			/**
			 * If file does not contain filtered word result we skip it from compression
			 */
			if(isFiltered) {
				if(!files[i].getName().endsWith(filterWord))
					return;
			}
			progressBar.setValue(i);
			JarEntry filesToAdd = new JarEntry(files[i].getName());
			filesToAdd.setTime(files[i].lastModified());
			out.putNextEntry(filesToAdd);
			System.out.println("[Compressing] "+files[i].getName());
			compressFile(out, files[i]);
		}
		progressBar.setValue(100);
	}
	/**
	 * Compresses File into output Jar file
	 * @param out JarOutputStream
	 * @param file File to Compress
	 * @throws IOException
	 */
	public static void compressFile(JarOutputStream out, File file) throws IOException {
		byte[] buffer = new byte[10240];
		FileInputStream fileIn = new FileInputStream(file);
		while(true) {
			int length = fileIn.read(buffer, 0, buffer.length);
			if(length <= 0)
				break;
			out.write(buffer, 0, length);
		}
		fileIn.close();
	}
	/**
	 * Creates Manifest with given attributes
	 * @param manifest Manifest File
	 */
	public static void appendAttributes(Manifest manifest) {
		manifest.getMainAttributes().put(Attributes.Name.MANIFEST_VERSION, manifestVersion);
		manifest.getMainAttributes().put(Attributes.Name.MAIN_CLASS, mainFile.replace(".class", ""));
	}

}

AutoJarApp.java

package org.arsenal.tools.manager;

import java.awt.Checkbox;

/**
 * Created Under the @see Arsenal Software Licensing
 * Simple Auto Jar Application Graphic Interface
 * @author Arsenal Development Team
 *
 */
public class AutoJarApp extends JFrame {

	private static final long serialVersionUID = 8068205405642771168L;

	private JTextField fileName;
	private JTextField mainClass;
	private Checkbox createMan;
	private Checkbox createBatch;
	private Checkbox filterType;
	private JFileChooser jFileChooser;
	private String directory = "";
	private JLabel directoryLabel;
	private JProgressBar progressBar;
	
	public AutoJarApp() {
		try {
			UIManager.setLookAndFeel(UIManager.getSystemLookAndFeelClassName());
		} catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		} catch (InstantiationException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		} catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		} catch (UnsupportedLookAndFeelException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
		setSize(430, 385);
		setResizable(false);
		setTitle("Auto Jar");
		getContentPane().setLayout(null);
		
		final JDesktopPane desktopPane = new JDesktopPane();
		desktopPane.setBackground(Color.WHITE);
		desktopPane.setBounds(0, 0, 426, 373);
		getContentPane().add(desktopPane);
		
		JButton createJar = new JButton("Create Jar");
		createJar.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
			public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent arg0) {
				JFrame error = new JFrame();
				if(directory.isEmpty() || directory == null) {
					JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(error, "Invalid file directory.", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE, null);
					return;
				}
				if(fileName.getText().isEmpty() || fileName.getText().equals("")) {
					JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(error, "Invalid Output name.", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE, null);
					return;
				}
				if(mainClass.getText().isEmpty() || mainClass.getText().equals("")) {
					JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(error, "Invalid Main Class.", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE, null);
					return;
				}
				System.out.println("Continued");
				AutoJar.outputName = fileName.getText()+".jar";
				AutoJar.mainFile = mainClass.getText()+".class";
				AutoJar.isManifest = createMan.getState();
				AutoJar.isFiltered = filterType.getState();
				AutoJar.dirName = directory;
				AutoJar.progressBar = progressBar;
				boolean isBatch = createBatch.getState();
				new AutoJar();
				if(isBatch) {
					File batchFile = new File(directory+"/"+fileName.getText()+".bat");
					try {
						BufferedWriter buffWrite = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(batchFile));
						PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(buffWrite);
						writer.println("@ECHO OFF");
						writer.println("ECHO THIS BATCH IS FOR TESTING PURPOSES ONLY");
						writer.println("ECHO DOUBLE CLICK "+fileName.getText()+".jar TO EXECUTE IT");
						writer.println("ECHO DEVELOPED UNDER ARSENAL SOFTWARE LICENSING");
						writer.println("ECHO CHECK YOUR LICENSE FROM REGISTRATION FOR MORE INFO");
						writer.println("@ECHO ON");
						writer.println("java -jar "+fileName.getText()+".jar");
						writer.println("@ECHO OFF");
						writer.println("pause");
						writer.flush();
						writer.close();
					} catch (IOException e) {
						e.printStackTrace();
					}
				}
			}
		});
		createJar.setBounds(22, 288, 377, 63);
		desktopPane.add(createJar);
		
		progressBar = new JProgressBar();
		progressBar.setStringPainted(true);
		progressBar.setBounds(22, 231, 377, 31);
		desktopPane.add(progressBar);
		
		createMan = new Checkbox("Create Manifest");
		createMan.setBounds(22, 186, 122, 22);
		desktopPane.add(createMan);
		
		filterType = new Checkbox("Filter File Type");
		filterType.setBounds(150, 186, 95, 22);
		desktopPane.add(filterType);
		
		createBatch = new Checkbox("Create Batch Script");
		createBatch.setBounds(271, 186, 128, 22);
		desktopPane.add(createBatch);
		
		JButton inputFiles = new JButton("Set Input Files");
		inputFiles.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
			public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
				jFileChooser = new JFileChooser();
				jFileChooser.setFileSelectionMode(JFileChooser.DIRECTORIES_ONLY);
				int returnValue = jFileChooser.showOpenDialog(AutoJarApp.this);
				if(returnValue == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
					directory = jFileChooser.getSelectedFile().getPath();
					directoryLabel.setText(directory);
				}
			}
		});
		inputFiles.setBounds(22, 25, 377, 23);
		desktopPane.add(inputFiles);
		
		fileName = new JTextField();
		fileName.setBounds(22, 84, 377, 20);
		desktopPane.add(fileName);
		fileName.setColumns(10);
		
		JLabel lblNewLabel = new JLabel("Output File Name (Ex: project1):");
		lblNewLabel.setBounds(22, 59, 207, 14);
		desktopPane.add(lblNewLabel);
		
		mainClass = new JTextField();
		mainClass.setBounds(22, 140, 377, 20);
		desktopPane.add(mainClass);
		mainClass.setColumns(10);
		
		JLabel lblMainClassex = new JLabel("Main Class (Ex: client):");
		lblMainClassex.setBounds(22, 115, 149, 14);
		desktopPane.add(lblMainClassex);
		
		directoryLabel = new JLabel("");
		directoryLabel.setBounds(22, 11, 377, 14);
		desktopPane.add(directoryLabel);
	}
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		new AutoJarApp().setVisible(true);
	}
}
